item.title: Urgent JOptionPane help repp++
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“collin123456, post:1, topic:423900”]i currently have:

[code]if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase(“Screen shot”)){
int p1 = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(this, “Yes for .png or no for .jpg”);
if(p1 == 0)
screeny();
else if((p1 == 1)
screeny2();
else
return;

		}[/code]

if no or cancel is clicked the box disappears, then reappears, then if you click it again it does what is is supposed to, can anybody tell me what is wrong and what i can do to fix it?[/quote]

I think that fix is what you are looking for.

item.title: Urgent JOptionPane help repp++
item.dc:creator: @collin123456 collin123456
item.description:
@collin123456 wrote:

i currently have:

[code]if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase(“Screen shot”)){
int p1;
if((p1 = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(this, “Yes for .png or no for .jpg”)) == 0)
screeny();
else if((p1 = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(this, “Yes for .png or no for .jpg”)) == 1)
screeny2();
else
return;

		}[/code]

if no or cancel is clicked the box disappears, then reappears, then if you click it again it does what is is supposed to, can anybody tell me what is wrong and what i can do to fix it?

Read full topic
